committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to authorize the minting of commemorative coins to support the training of American athletes participating in the 1988 Olympic Games.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate, amended) 1988 Olympic Commemorative Coin Act - Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to issue a specified number of gold and silver coins emblematic of the participation of American athletes in the 1988 Olympic Games. Sets forth certain features of the coins and provides for their sale and issuance. Requires all sales to include specified surcharges. Requires all surcharges to be paid to the United States Olympic Committee. Terminates the minting of the coins on June 30, 1989.

titles.title: A bill to authorize the minting of commemorative coins to support the training of American athletes participating in the 1988 Olympic Games.
